channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Nonprofit Caught in the Fray of Trump’s Attacks on Big Law
item.description: A federal inquiry into D.E.I. practices at 20 law firms zeroed in on SEO, a decades-old program that helps students land jobs on Wall Street.

item.title: This nutrition expert avoids a so-called health food at all costs: he says you’re better going full fat instead
item.description: Low-fat yogurt often contains artificial sweeteners and added sugar and flavors.

item.title: The truth about ‘condoms for Gaza’: DOGE canceled $33 million USAID contract treating 350,000 HIV patients
item.description: In an exclusive interview, Trish Karlin of the Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation discusses the impact of $32.7m worth of contracts being term...

item.title: Trump hints at ‘flexibility’ on reciprocal tariffs while balking at more ‘exceptions’
item.description: Stock indexes rebounded from a morning selloff after Trump’s tariff comments to finish the day with narrow gains.

item.title: Apple is reportedly willing to lose $1 billion every year just to fuel its streaming ambitions
item.description: Unlike other peers, the streaming service's small library focuses almost exclusively on original content like Severance and Ted Lasso.

item.title: Trump Revokes Security Clearances for Biden, Harris, Clinton and More
item.description: The tally of names read like President Trump’s enemies list, from Letitia James to Liz Cheney.

item.title: George Foreman, Boxing Champion and Grilling Magnate, Dies at 76
item.description: He claimed a world title in his 20s and again in his 40s, and then made millions selling grills.

item.title: CEO of $30 billion homebuilding empire sees ‘weaker-for-longer’ housing market as consumer confidence plummets
item.description: “Mortgage interest rates have remained higher-for-longer, which has left the overall housing market weaker-for-longer,” Lennar chairman and co-CEO Stu...

item.title: Decades Ago, Columbia Refused to Pay Trump $400 Million
item.description: A quarter century ago, the university was looking to expand. It considered, and rejected, property owned by Donald Trump. He did not forget it.

item.title: Inside the Turmoil at the V.A. Mental Health System Under Trump
item.description: A chaotic restructuring ordered threatens to degrade services for veterans of wars in Vietnam, Iraq and Afghanistan.

item.title: Rockets Fired From Lebanon Prompt Israeli Airstrikes
item.description: Israel retaliated after rockets were fired from Lebanon toward Israel for the first time in months. Israel said the airstrikes targeted sites linked t...

item.title: The Carney Doctrine on Trump: Demand Respect, Be Patient, Diversify
item.description: On the road with the prime minister, we learned more about his approach to President Trump.

item.title: Flights Resume at Heathrow After Substation Fire Shut Down Airport
item.description: The blaze forced Britain’s largest airport to cancel or divert more than 1,000 flights on Friday and removed a linchpin of global air travel. Countert...

item.title: Spring Awakening
item.description: Being new at something isn’t always pleasant, but beyond the discomfort, rewards await.

item.title: South Korea Protests Swell as Court Weighs President Yoon’s Fate
item.description: Mass rallies for and against Yoon Suk Yeol filled the streets on Saturday as the Constitutional Court prepared to rule on whether his ill-fated imposi...
